intro: Salvia nipponica subsp. nipponica, commonly known as Japanese sage, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are violet to purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and bloom in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable addition to gardens and landscapes.
